sections.heading: The Electoral Process
sections.content: Elections are a formal group decision-making process by which a population chooses an individual to hold public office. Elections have been the usual mechanism by which modern representative democracy has operated since the 17th century.

sections.heading: Voting Rights and Age
sections.content: The right to vote is a fundamental aspect of democracy. In most democratic countries, the minimum voting age is 18 years old, allowing adult citizens to participate in the selection of their representatives.

sections.heading: Understanding Constituencies
sections.content: A constituency, also known as an electoral district, is a distinct area whose population is represented by a member in a legislative body. Voters within a constituency elect their representative(s) to parliament or other assemblies.
